description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability in the Windows Telephony Service (CVE-2024-43621):

1. Download and apply the necessary updates that address this vulnerability from the official Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
   - [KB5046617](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046617)
   - [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
   - [KB5046665](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046665)

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update resolves the heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the Windows Telephony Service that could allow remote code execution.
- Ensure that your system is running the affected builds, including Windows 10 Versions 21H2, 22H2, and Windows 11 Versions 22H2, 23H2, or 24H2.
- For further information and instructions, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide: [MSRC CVE-2024-43621](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43621).
**Preconditions**:
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
- Administrative privileges are required to apply these updates.
